column2: "Ah, just in time thee two. We hath taken a reply from the Shironian King."
"Yond wast what I've did expect from him. Wouldn't thee concur, Kotoshiro?"
"The usual formalities. Of course, before listing the Kuronite's transgressions in full, while assuming you'll enact divine punishment on them."
"He's shown no signs of being able to work with them, let alone make peace."
"Now now, you two. The current Shironian King, is a coward. He'll lock himself up in his castle, ill afraid of displeasing any of his citizens."
"As much hath it pains me so, this rather is expected of him."
"And what of the Kuronite King?"
"Nothing as of yet."
"Well now, they're taketh their time."
"Those wicked children seemeth to be absent for now. We shouldst taketh this opportunity and heareth what the he sayeth."
"Allow me to accompany you."
"Thee clotpole. Thee may be mine own guardian, but thou art a Shironian. Taking thee 'long would only complicate matters."
"Yet I would think it would be unwise to let you go unguarded, Lady Sukuna-hime."
"The two of us could go with you, right <%me>?"
"1. Nod in agreement"
"2. Stay silent"
"You think it's too dangerous, don't you? Not just for Sukuna-hime, but me as well. I understand."
"But we're in too deep with this to back out now."
"My most humble apology about this, normally I wouldn't involve outsiders into our affairs."
"Hey, it will be just fine. Don't worry about us, we're here to protect everyone."
"Well then, we better hurry."
"\"To protect everyone,\" the lady maketh sound so simple."
"But those words carryeth a lot of weight, they not?"
